metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25692 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference was found in OpenLDAP server and was fixed in openldap 2.4.55, during a request for renaming RDNs. An unauthenticated attacker could remotely crash the slapd process by sending a specially crafted request, causing a Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7
libldap-common - 2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7
slapd - 2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.45+dfsg-1ubuntu1.7').
